meanings.definition: To propel something through the air with a motion of the arm and hand.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys throwing a ball to her dog.
meanings.sent2: He is throwing a frisbee at the park.
meanings.sent3: The kids are throwing a birthday party for their friend.
meanings.sent4: The sun is throwing its warm rays across the field.
meanings.sent5: Throwing colorful confetti in the air made the celebration even more joyful.

meanings.sent1: His throwing of the baseball was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The coach praised her throwing during practice.
meanings.sent3: The throwing of the dice determined the winner of the game.
meanings.sent4: The throwing of the bouquet at the wedding was caught by a delighted guest.
meanings.sent5: The loud throwing of the hammer echoed through the stadium.

meanings.definition: To cause something to fall forcefully or violently.
meanings.sent1: The storm is throwing branches onto the road.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally knocked over the vase, throwing it to the ground.
meanings.sent3: The chef was throwing ingredients into the pot with flair.
meanings.sent4: His sudden outburst was like throwing a bomb into the peaceful meeting.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake was throwing everything in the room into chaos.
